body: @ascrutae IMO, If we support partial disabled, definitely, we can disable all plugins.

we can add the following example configuration to `sky-walking.conf`.
```
# Default value
DISABLE_PLUGINS=

# All plugins are disabled
DISABLE_PLUGINS= ALL

# Part of plugins are disabled
DISABLE_PLUGINS=MONGDB,TOMCAT,
```
This could be a bug. I will test it first.
@wu-sheng  Yeah, This cloud be fine when agent start.  But in my opinion, I want to add dynamic effective mechanism to control the mechanism which disable plugin.
Why need this? Do you know any story?
I think that would be cool.

@ascrutae Yes, it is a cool feature. But I think it is a new feature. I prefer you submit a new issue for discussion. For doing that, we did not just need a config initialization, but a config watch and a notification.
@wu-sheng Ok, I will submit a new issue for this. we can add mechanism to disable plugin when agent start first. this function will finish on 3.1

@ascrutae If you want to implement this in 3.1 milestone, you should send POC-PR first.

**POC-PR**, is a pull request, which includes your major point about how to change codes. By using this, we can discuss detail first, and no need wait for finishing all codes. This will be more efficient. 

If you decide to do so, the pr title should start with `[POC-PR]`, which tells all reviewers that do not concern the detail too much. Because there will be a formal PR later.
 
cc @sky-walking

```
Spring Cloud Netflix  ->  REST Client: Feign  ->  ApacheHttpClient/ribbon(maybe)/okhttp
```

cc @pengys5
Closing this, since this is not important right now.

Almost finished, just need fix some typo.

Feign is a java to http client binder inspired by Retrofit, JAXRS-2.0, and WebSocket.
Spring Cloud integrates Ribbon and Eureka to provide a load balanced http client when using Feign.
Feign provide JAX-RS,OkHttp,httpclient,HttpURLConnection.

So if we provide JAX-RS,OkHttp,httpclient,HttpURLConnection plugins, skywalking will support spring cloud restful interface.

Coverage increased (+0.6%) to 71.666% when pulling **ee0a569eacb822dcab2507279dae18349ffa24ee on feature/198** into **c3259afae0e4a267397d91c6117737aa4b7a2e54 on master**.
What happens on server side?  I can guess the point, but do you have any real cases?
For example Dubbox provide service by tomcat/jetty. Should we ignore the tomcat component or not?
If we do this, we must provide `provider` span. But these is a problem, which one should we keep in segment, first or last ? I assume IT is hard to tell.

Each plugin knows whether it is the leaf span. and the span generated by each RPC plugin is peer to peer, one span generate in client side and it must generate one in server side，So we know that span before the RPC plugin generated in server side should be ignore or not.
Leaf concept don't match the server side. The root  span or some child are service provider, but other child are not. How can you ignore the spans?

> For example Dubbox provide service by tomcat/jetty. Should we ignore the tomcat component or not?

Let's discuss on this case. How does the tomcat plugin know these is dubbox component? As you known, Tomcat provide service first, then dubbox. If we want to ignore tomcat, we must do this in the dubbox component. Do you agree?

If yes, at that moment, tomcat plugin's beforeInvoke  has already finished, so `span` and its tags have been generated, and stored in memory. Even we can ignore the tomcat plugin span, the improvement focuses on the cost of network/collector-side, right?

If you agree all of these, we are on the same page. Do you have any proposal about how to ignore the tomcat span, when the dubbox span started? IMO, my only thought is getting the prev span in active-span-stack.

I agree with you. this question you talking about is how to determine the start time of dubbox component. IMO, we can pop the span that generate before dubbo  component when dubbox component finish.

BTW, the same question also happen in RPC client.
The `pop` operation will trigger bad things. Because after dubbox component finished, Tomcat plugin afterInvoke will invoke, if you pop the stack, this must throw an exception.
Solved.

This issue caused by that Elasticsearch uses a hybrid mmapfs / niofs directory by default to store its indices. The default operating system limits on mmap counts is likely to be too low.

You may execute the following command on docker host.
```shell
sysctl -w vm.max_map_count=262144
```

it works! thx
@snecker Thanks for your feedback. Closing this issue.

首先，我们会支持Spring boot和cloud中的同步调用，我们由于已经支持Tomcat 7+的内核，所以Spring boot的mvc已经被支持，无需其他扩展，即服务提供方已支持。

其次针对客户端，要看你使用哪种rest框架进行调用，目前已经支持的是okhttp 3.x(https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/pull/197)和httpclient。

目前支持的框架列表可参考
- 开发版本：https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/tree/master/apm-sniffer/apm-sdk-plugin
- 发布版本：https://github.com/wu-sheng/sky-walking/wiki/3.0-supported-list

@pengys5 将很快提供更多的http客户端框架的支持。
